io.github.mywarp.mywarp.warp.storage

Class LegacyWarpSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.mywarp.mywarp.warp.storage.LegacyWarpSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WarpSource

    @Allow(value={SQLITE,MYSQL,MARIADB})
 @Require(value={SQLITE,MYSQL,MARIADB})
public final class LegacyWarpSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements WarpSource
    A WarpSource for databases with a legacy scheme (pre 3.0).

    The legacy database stores player and world names as strings, instead of using unique IDs. Calling getWarps() will convert both. Player names are acquired by calling the configured PlayerNameResolver, witch may result in a blocking call.

    Call from(DataSource, String, String) to create instances.

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public static LegacyWarpSource.LegacyWarpImporterBuilder from(javax.sql.DataSource dataSource,
                                                              java.lang.String tableName,
                                                              @Nullable
                                                              java.lang.String databaseName)
                                                       throws StorageInitializationException
        Creates a builder for creating a new LegacyWarpSource instance.

        This instance will import warps from the given dataSource, using the given tableName and, if not null, databaseName.

        Parameters:
        dataSource - the DataSource that provides a connection to the DBMS
        tableName - the name of the DB table that contains the warps
        databaseName - the name of the database (somtimes also called schema that contains the table. May be null if the DBMS does not support multiple databases.
        Returns:
        a builder step
        Throws:
        StorageInitializationException - if the given dataSource does not connect to a DBMS or the DBMS is not supported

      • getWarps

        public java.util.List<Warp> getWarps()
        Description copied from interface: WarpSource
        Gets all readable Warps.
        Specified by:
        getWarps in interface WarpSource
        Returns:
        a list with all readable Warps
